org.apache.geode.cache30

Class RegionTestCase

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.geode.test.dunit.internal.JUnit4DistributedTestCase
      • org.apache.geode.test.dunit.cache.internal.JUnit4CacheTestCase
        • org.apache.geode.cache30.RegionTestCase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, org.apache.geode.test.dunit.cache.internal.CacheTestFixture, org.apache.geode.test.dunit.internal.DistributedTestFixture
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MultiVMRegionTestCase

    public abstract class RegionTestCase
extends org.apache.geode.test.dunit.cache.internal.JUnit4CacheTestCase
    An abstract class whose test methods test the functionality of a region regardless of its scope.

    This class also contains functionality that is used by subclasses. See getRegionAttributes(). TODO:davidw: Test CacheStatistics

    Since:
    GemFire 3.0
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • waitForInvalidate

        protected void waitForInvalidate(Region.Entry entry,
                                 long p_tilt)
        Since tilt is the earliest time we expect, one must check the current time before invoking the operation intended to keep the entry alive.
        Parameters:
        entry - entry we want to be invalidated
        p_tilt - earliest time we expect to see the invalidate

      • waitForInvalidate

        protected void waitForInvalidate(Region.Entry entry,
                                 long p_tilt,
                                 int pauseMs)
        Since tilt is the earliest time we expect, one must check the current time before invoking the operation intended to keep the entry alive.
        Parameters:
        entry - entry we want to be invalidated
        p_tilt - earliest time we expect to see the invalidate
        pauseMs - the number of milliseconds to pause before checking again

      • waitForDestroy

      • testCustomEntryTtl1

        public void testCustomEntryTtl1()
        Verify that special entries expire but other entries in the region don't

      • testCustomEntryTtl2

        public void testCustomEntryTtl2()
        Verify that special entries don't expire but other entries in the region do

      • testCustomEntryTtl3

        public void testCustomEntryTtl3()
        Expire an entry with a custom expiration. Set a new custom expiration, create the same entry again, make sure it observes the new expiration

      • testEntryTtl3

        public void testEntryTtl3()
        Configure entry expiration with a ttl time. Create an entry and records its scheduled expiration time. Then mutate the region expiration configuration and confirm that the entry's expiration time is rescheduled.

      • testRegionIdleInvalidate

        public void testRegionIdleInvalidate()
                              throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                     CacheException
        Tests that a region that remains idle for a given amount of time is invalidated. Also tests that accessing an entry of a region or a subregion counts as an access.

        java.lang.InterruptedException
